sen.j: 阿部 十郎（あべ じゅうろう、天保8年8月22日 (旧暦)（1837年9月21日） - 明治40年（1907年）1月6日）は新選組隊士である。
sen.e: Juro ABE (born on September 21, 1837 and died on January 6, 1907) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a special police force).
Juro ABE (born on September 21, 1837 and died on January 6, 1907) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a special police force).
Juro ABE (born on September 21, 1837 and died on January 6, 1907) was a member of the Shinsengumi (a special police force).

sen.j: 別名は高野十郎。
sen.e: Another name was Juro TAKANO.
Another name was Juro TAKANO.
Another name was Juro TAKANO.

sen.j: 維新後は、隆明と改名。
sen.e: After the Meiji Restoration, he changed his name into Takaaki.
After the Meiji Restoration, he changed his name into Takaaki.
After the Meiji Restoration, he changed his name into Takaaki.

sen.j: 天保8年（1837年）、出羽国由利郡羽広村の百姓・阿部多郎兵衛の次男として生まれる。
sen.e: In 1837, he was born in Habiro Village, Yuri County, Dewa Province as a second son of Tarobe ABE, a farmer.
In 1837, he was born in Habiro Village, Yuri County, Dewa Province as a second son of Tarobe ABE, a farmer.
In 1837, he was born in Habiro Village, Yuri County, Dewa Province as a second son of Tarobe ABE, a farmer.

sen.j: 大坂の谷万太郎の下で剣術を学び文久3年（1863年）、壬生浪士組（後の新選組）に加盟。
sen.e: He learned swordmanship from Mantaro TANI and joined Mibu Roshigumi (later, it became the Shinsengumi).
He learned swordmanship from Mantaro TANI in Osaka and joined Mibu Roshigumi (later, it became the Shinsengumi) in 1863..
sen.cmt: 大阪の、1863年： 訳もれです。
sen.e: He learned swordmanship from Mantaro TANI in Osaka and joined Mibu Roshigumi (later, it became the Shinsengumi) in 1863..

sen.j: 谷と共に大坂ぜんざい屋事件などに活躍した。
sen.e: He played an important roll in Osaka Zenzai-ya incident (attack in a sweet-red-bean shop to defeat anti-Tokugawa shogunate samurai).
He played an important roll with Tani in Osaka Zenzai-ya incident (attack in a sweet-red-bean shop to defeat anti-Tokugawa shogunate samurai).
He played an important roll with Tani in Osaka Zenzai-ya incident (attack in a sweet-red-bean shop to defeat anti-Tokugawa shogunate samurai).

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）に一度脱退し、慶応元年（1865年）に復帰したとされる。
sen.e: It is said that he left the group in 1864 and later, in 1865, he returned to it.
It is said that he left the group in 1864 and later, in 1865, he returned to it.
It is said that he left the group in 1864 and later, in 1865, he returned to it.

sen.j: 新選組では伍長・砲術師範などを勤めた。
sen.e: In the Shinsengumi, he served as gocho (a corporal) and hojutsu shihan (instructor for gunnery).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: In the Shinsengumi, he served as gocho (a corporal) and hojutsu shihan (instructor for gunnery).
In the Shinsengumi, he served as gocho (a corporal) and hojutsu shihan (instructor for gunnery).

sen.j: しかし、慶応3年（1867年）3月に分離して伊東甲子太郎ら12名と共に御陵衛士を結成する。
sen.e: However, in March 1867, he left it and organized Goryoeiji (a group to protect Emperors' graves) with 12 people including Kashitaro Ito.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: However, in March 1867, he left it and organized Goryoeiji (a group to protect Emperors' graves) with 12 people including Kashitaro Ito.
However, in March 1867, he left it and organized Goryoeiji (a group to protect Emperors' graves) with 12 people including Kashitaro Ito.

sen.j: 油小路の変時は外出中で難を逃れた。
sen.e: Luckily, he was not involved in Aburanokoji no hen (Aburanokoji incident) because he was out at that time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Luckily, he was not involved in Aburanokoji no hen (Aburanokoji incident) because he was out at that time.
Luckily, he was not involved in Aburanokoji no hen (Aburanokoji incident) because he was out at that time.

sen.j: 後に事件を知らされ、薩摩藩邸に逃げ込んだ。
sen.e: Later, when he knew the incident, he escaped to the residence of Satsuma Domain.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外処理
sen.e: Later, when he knew the incident, he escaped to the residence of Satsuma Domain.
Later, when he knew the incident, he escaped to the residence of Satsuma Domain.

sen.j: 復讐の機会を窺っていた御陵衛士残党と共に、伏見墨染で近藤勇を襲撃して負傷させる。
sen.e: He and the remnants of Goryoeiji who were waiting for the day when they could get revenge attacked and injured Isami KONDO in Fushimi Sumizome.
He and the remnants of Goryoeiji who were waiting for the day when they could get revenge attacked and injured Isami KONDO in Fushimi Sumizome.
He and the remnants of Goryoeiji who were waiting for the day when they could get revenge attacked and injured Isami KONDO in Fushimi Sumizome.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争では薩摩藩の中村半次郎に属し、鳥羽伏見の戦いなどに参加。
sen.e: In the Boshin War, he worked under Hanjiro NAKAMURA, statesman of the Satsuma clan and joined in wars including the battle of Toba-Fushimi.
In the Boshin War, he worked under Hanjiro NAKAMURA, statesman of the Satsuma clan and joined in wars including the battle of Toba-Fushimi.
In the Boshin War, he worked under Hanjiro NAKAMURA, statesman of the Satsuma clan and joined in wars including the battle of Toba-Fushimi.

sen.j: 後に赤報隊に加わる。
sen.e: Later, he joined in Sekihotai or Sekiho Amy (a group of Japanese political extremists).
Later, he joined in Sekihotai or Sekiho Amy (a group of Japanese political extremists).
Later, he joined in Sekihotai or Sekiho Amy (a group of Japanese political extremists).

sen.j: 戦後は弾正台や開拓使、北海道庁 (1886-1947)に出仕した。
sen.e: After the war, he served as a public officer such as danjodai (police or supervisor for public servants) and a pioneer and also, he worked in the Hokkaido government.
After the war, he served as a public officer such as danjodai (police or supervisor for public servants) and a pioneer and also, he worked in the Hokkaido development commission (1886-1947).
sen.cmt: (1886-1947)：訳もれです。開拓使：用語集の訳に訂正しました。
sen.e: After the war, he served as a public officer such as danjodai (police or supervisor for public servants) and a pioneer and also, he worked in the Hokkaido development commission (1886-1947).

sen.j: 退官後は札幌市で果樹園（北海道果樹協会）を経営し、リンゴ栽培などを営んだ。
sen.e: After he retired, he ran an orchard in Sapporo (Hokkaido Kaju Association), cultivating fruits such as apples.
After he retired, he ran an orchard in Sapporo (Hokkaido Kaju Association), cultivating fruits such as apples.
After he retired, he ran an orchard in Sapporo (Hokkaido Kaju Association), cultivating fruits such as apples.

sen.j: 明治40年（1907年）、東京にて死去。
sen.e: In 1907, he died in Tokyo.
In 1907, he died in Tokyo.
In 1907, he died in Tokyo.

sen.j: 享年71。
sen.e: Died at the age of 71.
He died at the age of 71.
He died at the age of 71.

sen.j: 維新後、元新選組隊士の安富才助を殺害したとされる。
sen.e: It is said that after the Meiji Restoraion, he killed Saisuke YASUTOMI, a former member of the Shinsengumi.
It is said that after the Meiji Restoraion, he killed Saisuke YASUTOMI, a former member of the Shinsengumi.
It is said that after the Meiji Restoraion, he killed Saisuke YASUTOMI, a former member of the Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 島田魁の記録に奥州二本松産とあるが、これは誤りである。
sen.e: The record written by Kai SHIMADA described 'made in Oshu Nihonmatsu', but it is wrong.
sen.cmt: ウィキぺディアを見ても、何が奥州二本松産なのか確定できなかったので、そのまま 'made in Oshu Nihonmatsu', と訳しました。
sen.e: The record written by Kai SHIMADA described 'made in Oshu Nihonmatsu', but it is wrong.
The record written by Kai SHIMADA described 'made in Oshu Nihonmatsu', but it is wrong.

sen.j: 明治30年代には史談会に出席して、幕末当時の貴重な談話を残している。
sen.e: In the 1890's, he attended the meetings where the participants talked about historic incidents and some valuable stories of the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate told there have been handed down for generations.

In the 1890's, he attended the meetings where the participants talked about historic incidents and some valuable stories of the last days of the Tokugawa shogunate told there have been handed down for generations.
